Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with amendments. With written report No. 101-501. Additional views filed.

Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: An Act to reimburse cattle owners in Montana, Wyoming, Idaho, and North Dakota and the governments of those States for expenses incurred to test cattle for brucellosis organisms carried outside certain units of the National Park System by elk and bison, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the Interior to reimburse cattle owners in Montana, Wyoming, North Dakota, and Idaho and the governments of such States for the costs of testing cattle for brucellosis if there is a demonstrated risk of infection from national park elk and bison herds. Requires a claimant to prove the validity of such claim by presenting bills or other explanations of expenses to the Secretary. Authorizes FY 1990 through 1992 appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to reimburse individuals for expenses incurred to test cattle for brucellosis organisms carried outside Yellowstone National Park by elk and bison, and for other purposes.

An Act to reimburse cattle owners in Montana, Wyoming, Idaho, and North Dakota and the governments of those States for expenses incurred to test cattle for brucellosis organisms carried outside certain units of the National Park System by elk and bison, and for other purposes.
